intro: Ditassa apiculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
